citation.article-title: Vibrio ordalii sp. nov.: a causative agent of vibriosis in fish.

p.s: Description of Vibrio ordalii sp. nov.
Vibrio ordalii (or.dgd.ii, M.L. gen. n. proposed in honor of Erling J. Ordal for his many contributions to the current understanding of the biology of bacteria pathogenic for fish)

Vibrio ordalii is proposed for the vibrio strains previously designated by various investigators as Vibrio sp. 1669 group [16], Vibrio sp. RT group [21], V. anguillarum biotype 2 [5,26], and V. anguillarum phenon II [14].
American Type Culture Collection strain 33509 (deposited at the ATCC by M.
S.) is the proposed holotype strain.
It was originally designated Dom F3 kid (DF3K) and was isolated in 1973 from kidney tissue of a moribund coho salmon (Oncorhynchus kisutch) at a commercial salmon farm in Puget Sound, Washington.
